article.title: Raytheon to Provide GPS Anti-Spoofing Modules
article.text: Raytheon Co., El Segundo, California, has been awarded a $44,136,550 indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract for Global Positioning System Selective Availability Anti-Spoofing Modules Lightning Strikes program. Work will be performed at El Segundo, California, and is expected to be complete by April 30, 2020. This award is the result of a sole-source acquisition. This contract is 100 percent foreign military sales to 57 partner nations. The Space and Missile Center, Los Angeles Air Force Base, California, is the contracting activity (FA8807-16-D-0002).
